advaita_vedanta_advanced.title: Adhyasa (Superimposition) - The Root of All Illusion
advaita_vedanta_advanced.original_sanskrit: यदा सर्वाणि भूतानि आत्मन्येवानुपश्यति । सर्वभूतेषु चात्मानं ततो न विजुगुप्सते ॥
advaita_vedanta_advanced.transliteration: yadā sarvāṇi bhūtāni ātmanyevānupaśyati | sarvabhūteṣu cātmānaṃ tato na vijugupsate ||
advaita_vedanta_advanced.acharya_commentary: Adi Shankaracharya explains that Adhyasa is the fundamental error where we superimpose the properties of the body-mind complex upon the Atman, and vice versa. This mutual superimposition is the root cause of all suffering and bondage.
advaita_vedanta_advanced.philosophical_depth: When one sees all beings in the Self alone, and the Self in all beings, then one does not feel hatred or aversion. This is only possible when the superimposition (adhyasa) of 'I' and 'mine' upon the body-mind is completely transcended through direct knowledge of Brahman.

practical_application.daily_practice: Constantly discriminate between the seer and the seen, the knower and the known. Practice Sakshi Bhava (witness consciousness) throughout daily activities.
practical_application.meditation_technique: Atma-Anatma Viveka - systematic discrimination between Self and non-Self through guided inquiry
practical_application.advanced_sadhana: Nirguna Dhyana - meditation on the attributeless Brahman beyond all qualities and forms

advaita_vedanta_advanced.warning_notes: This teaching should only be given to qualified students who have purified their minds through ethical living and preliminary spiritual practices.

sankhya_advanced.title: Kaivalya - The Absolute Isolation of Purusha
sankhya_advanced.original_sanskrit: पुरुषार्थो ऽयं सर्वो गुणत्रयविमोक्षात् । साम्यावस्था गुणानां प्रकृतेर्महदादिमत् ॥
sankhya_advanced.transliteration: puruṣārtho 'yaṃ sarvo guṇatrayavimokṣāt | sāmyāvasthā guṇānāṃ prakṛtermahadādimat ||
sankhya_advanced.acharya_commentary: Gaudapada explains that Kaivalya is not mere isolation but the supreme goal where Purusha realizes its complete independence from Prakriti. The three gunas return to their state of equilibrium, having fulfilled their purpose of showing the Purusha its true nature.
sankhya_advanced.philosophical_depth: Kaivalya represents the culmination of discriminative knowledge where consciousness (Purusha) recognizes its eternal separation from matter (Prakriti). This is not a state to be attained but the recognition of what has always been true - the absolute independence and purity of consciousness.

practical_application.daily_practice: Cultivate detached observation of the play of the three gunas in all experiences. Practice Purusha-Prakriti Viveka constantly.
practical_application.meditation_technique: Sakshi Purusha Dhyana - meditation on the witness consciousness that remains untouched by all modifications of Prakriti
practical_application.advanced_sadhana: Kevala Kaivalya Abhyasa - sustained practice of resting in pure consciousness without any objective support

sankhya_advanced.integration_notes: This teaching perfectly complements Advaita Vedanta when understood as the preliminary discrimination necessary for Brahman realization.

samadhi_states_advanced.title: Nirbija Samadhi - Seedless Absorption
samadhi_states_advanced.acharya_commentary: Vyasa explains that in Nirbija Samadhi, even the subtle impressions (samskaras) that support Sabija Samadhi are dissolved. This is the state of complete cessation where consciousness rests in its own nature without any objective support whatsoever.
samadhi_states_advanced.philosophical_depth: This represents the highest achievement in Yoga where the yogin transcends even the subtle seeds of latent impressions. Unlike Sabija Samadhi which still has an object of concentration, Nirbija Samadhi is pure subjectivity - consciousness knowing itself without any mediation.

practical_application.preparation_required: Mastery of Sabija Samadhi in all its forms, complete purification of mind, total detachment from results
practical_application.entry_method: From the highest Sabija Samadhi, allow even the subtlest mental support to dissolve into pure awareness
practical_application.advanced_technique: Nirupadhika Samadhi - absorption without any conditioning or limiting adjuncts

stages_of_attainment: Preliminary glimpses during deep Sabija Samadhi
Complete transcendence of the Yogic process itself
samadhi_states_advanced.warning_notes: This state cannot be forced or practiced directly. It arises spontaneously when all seeking and effort are transcended.

spanda_doctrine.title: Spanda - The Supreme Vibratory Movement of Consciousness
spanda_doctrine.original_sanskrit: यः स्वतन्त्रः स्वशक्त्या सकलं भुवनं स्वतः । निर्मिमीते विलापयत्युदयास्तमयौ जगत् ॥
spanda_doctrine.transliteration: yaḥ svatantraḥ svaśaktyā sakalaṃ bhuvanaṃ svataḥ | nirmimīte vilāpayaty udayāstamayau jagat ||
spanda_doctrine.acharya_commentary: Kallata explains that Spanda is the inherent dynamism of Shiva-consciousness, the spontaneous creative pulsation that manifests and dissolves the entire universe while remaining eternally free and self-dependent.
spanda_doctrine.philosophical_depth: Spanda represents the Kashmir Shaivism understanding that consciousness is not static pure awareness (as in Advaita) but dynamic creative power. This divine vibration is both the cause and substance of all manifestation, yet remains forever unbound by its own creations.

practical_application.recognition_practice: Pratyabhijna Yoga - recognizing the divine creative power in every moment of experience
practical_application.breathing_technique: Spanda Pranayama - breathing in harmony with the cosmic pulsation
practical_application.advanced_method: Shakti-Pata reception - awakening to the transmission of divine energy from guru to disciple

stages_of_realization: Glimpses of dynamic consciousness in meditation
Recognition of Spanda in daily activities
spanda_doctrine.unique_features: Unlike other systems, Kashmir Shaivism sees the world as real divine play, not illusion to be transcended.

rita_cosmic_order.title: Rita - The Cosmic Principle of Natural Order
rita_cosmic_order.original_sanskrit: ऋतं च सत्यं चाभीद्धात्तपसोऽध्यजायत । ततो रात्र्यजायत ततः समुद्रो अर्णवः ॥
rita_cosmic_order.transliteration: ṛtaṃ ca satyaṃ cābhīddhāt tapaso 'dhyajāyata | tato rātryajāyata tataḥ samudro arṇavaḥ ||
rita_cosmic_order.acharya_commentary: Sayana explains that Rita is the cosmic principle that governs both natural and moral order. It is the divine law from which even the gods derive their power and authority.
rita_cosmic_order.philosophical_depth: Rita represents the Vedic understanding that the universe operates according to divine principles of harmony, truth, and natural justice. This cosmic order is both transcendent (governing celestial movements) and immanent (manifesting in moral and spiritual law).

practical_application.daily_alignment: Live in harmony with natural rhythms and cosmic cycles
practical_application.ethical_conduct: Follow Dharma as participation in the cosmic order of Rita
practical_application.spiritual_practice: Rita Upasana - worship and meditation on cosmic harmony

modern_relevance: Understanding natural law in science and spirituality
Social justice as reflection of cosmic justice
Ayurvedic medicine based on natural rhythms
rita_cosmic_order.integration_with_other_systems: Rita forms the foundation for understanding Dharma in all its applications - personal, social, and cosmic.
